<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Advertising, promotion and selling expenses for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $260,625, as compared to $578,970 for the year ended December 31, 2014, a decrease of $318,345.&#160; For the year ended December 31, 2014, the Predecessor company incurred considerably more expenses across most categories of advertising and marketing expenses, including higher salaries, marketing design, demos and tradeshows.&#160; In addition, broker commissions were higher by $112,000 for the year ended December 31, 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	General and administrative expenses for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $1,211,423, as compared to $595,199 for the year ended December 31, 2014, an increase of $616,224.&#160; Contributing to this increase for year ended December 31, 2015 was stock based compensation totaling $350,703.&#160; In addition, we paid higher management and executive salaries and payroll related costs and benefits during the year ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Legal and professional fees are broken out for discussion purposes.&#160; Legal fees for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $66,419, as compared to $385,784 for the year ended December 31, 2014, a decrease of $319,365.&#160; This decrease is due primarily to an award of attorneys' fees against the Predecessor during the year ended December 31, 2014 in a lawsuit where it was the defendant, as well as their own legal fees defending in the matter.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	During the three months ended March 31, 2015, the parties settled the case with the Predecessor agreeing to pay $275,000 in full and final settlement of the case.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Professional fees for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $206,342 compared to $84,409 for the year ended December 31, 2014, an offsetting increase of $121,933.&#160; This is related primarily to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	audits, accounting and outside consulting services related to being a public reporting company, which also required an audit of the Predecessor company for SEC reporting purposes by the Company.

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Interest expense for the year ended December 31, 2015 was $107,213, as compared to $125,169 for the year ended December 31, 2014, a decrease of $17,956.&#160; Included in interest expense for the year ended December 31, 2014 is $120,000 related to the amortization of a debt discount.&#160; In September
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	2014, in connection with new funding of $120,000, the Predecessor issued four promissory notes with equity participation.&#160;
</FONT>
	In accordance with accounting guidance for beneficial conversion features (BCF), the Predecessor recorded a debt discount of $120,000 representing the BCF intrinsic value.&#160; The entire debt discount was amortized to interest expense during the year ended December 31, 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Aggregate amortization of debt discounts on third party and related party debt was $68,466 for the year ended December 31, 2015 related to four loans entered into in March 2015:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="AC502D013D404506B78AF5628F038C63" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We entered into two 60-day promissory notes for cash proceeds of $50,000 each.&#160; The notes included an equity payment totaling 30,000 shares of common stock that were issued with the debt.&#160; The relative fair value of the stock was determined to be $9,020 and was recorded as a debt discount.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="2038EA1041974423AC625C509CCA79DC" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We borrowed $200,000 used for the Acquisition.&#160; The note was issued in conjunction with an equity payment totaling 176,734 shares of Series B preferred stock that was issued with the debt.&#160; The relative fair value of the stock was determined to be $142,434 and was recorded as a debt discount.&#160; The discount will be amortized over the life of the loans to interest expense.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="5518B1F2565E41E1925F649546FC5EBA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We entered into a 60 day-promissory note for cash proceeds of $50,000 with a member of management.&#160; The note also included an equity payment of 200,000 shares of common stock that were issued with the debt.&#160; The relative fair value of the stock was determined to be $29,420 and was recorded as a debt discount.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="D1F3D188F5E74011AC099DC3AD9F0693" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We borrowed $60,000 from a member of management used for the Acquisition.&#160; The note was issued in conjunction with an equity payment totaling 53,073 shares of Series B preferred stock that was issued with the debt.&#160; The relative fair value of the stock was determined to be $42,742 and was recorded as a debt discount.&#160; The discount will be amortized over the life of the loans to interest expense.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	- 30 -
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	In April 2015, we entered into a factoring agreement to sell, with recourse, certain receivables to an unrelated third-party financial institution.&#160; Under the terms of the factoring agreement, we receive an advance of 80% of qualified receivables and are subject to the requirement that the maximum amount of outstanding advances at any one time will not exceed $500,000.&#160; For the nine months ended December 31, 2015 (Successor), we recognized factoring interest and fees of $34,069.&#160; We pay factoring fees associated with the sale of receivables at the rate of 0.67% of the gross face value of the receivable for every ten-day period or fraction thereof from the date of the advance until the receivable is paid in full.
</DIV>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Current assets as of December 31, 2015 (Successor) and December 31, 2014 (Predecessor) primarily relate to $43,856 and $125,312 in cash, $259,619 and $254,705 in accounts receivable and $196,220 and $286,070 in inventory, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Current liabilities as of December 31, 2015 (Successor) and as of December 31, 2014 (Predecessor) primarily relate to $282,845 and $616,719 in accounts payable, $-0- and $123,689 in notes payable and capital leases, $177,589 and $106,899 for accrued expenses and $110,663 and $-0- for factoring payable, respectively.&#160; In addition, as of December 31 2014 (Predecessor), there were $342,924 in reserves for legal settlements as discussed previously under legal and professional fees.
</DIV>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	- 31 -
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Operating Activities
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Net cash used in operating activities for the year ended December 31, 2015 was $609,652, as compared to $268,520 for the year ended December 31, 2014.&#160; The increase in net cash used in operating activities is primarily attributable to non-cash items consisting of amortization of intangible assets ($62,500 compared to $-0-), common stock issued for services ($311,080 compared to $-0-), depreciation expense from discontinued operations ($115,441 compared to $-0-) and loss on sale of the brewery assets ($256,773 compared to $-0-).&#160; The gain on forgiveness of accrued payroll offset this increase net cash used in operating activities ($500,000 compared to $-0-).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Investing Activities
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Net cash used in investing activities for the year ended December 31, 2015 was $40,039, as compared to $4,929 for the year ended December 31, 2014.&#160; The increase in net cash used by investing activities was primarily from purchases of property and equipment of $34,639 for the year ended December 31, 2015.&#160; Our
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	acquisition of the
</FONT>
	b&#250;cha&#174; Live Kombucha brand
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	on April 1, 2015 required the cash outlay of $400,000.&#160; T
</FONT>
	his investment was almost completely offset by cash received from the sale of the brewery assets on October 1, 2015 of $395,650.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Financing Activities
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Net cash provided by financing activities for the year ended December 31, 2015 was $177,180, as compared to $112,503 for the year ended December 31, 2014.&#160; The increase of net cash provided by financing activities was mainly attributable to proceeds from factoring of accounts receivable ($110,663), issuance of common stock and Series B Preferred stock for cash ($86,200) and proceeds from new borrowings on notes payable ($288,320).&#160; These amounts were offset by repayment of notes payable and capital lease obligations of $308,003 for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Going Concern
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our financial statements have been prepared assuming we will continue as a going concern, which contemplates, among other things, the realization of assets and satisfaction of liabilities in the normal course of business.&#160; We had an accumulated deficit of $3,331,878 and $4,863,782 as of December 31, 2015 (Successor) and December 31, 2014 (Predecessor), respectively, had net losses of $1,031,311, $72,022 and $891,435 for the nine months ended December 31, 2015 (Successor), for the three months ended March 31, 2015 (Predecessor) and for the year ended December 31, 2014 (Predecessor), respectively, and had negative working capital of $45,138 as of December 31, 2015.&#160; These matters, among others, raise substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	While we are attempting to increase sales and generate additional revenues, our cash position may not be significant enough to support our daily operations.&#160; If we are unable to obtain additional financing through the issuance of debt or equity, we may be unable to continue as a going concern.&#160; While we believe our strategy to generate additional revenues and our ability to raise additional funds, there can be no assurances to that effect.&#160; Our financial statements do not include any adjustments relating to the recoverability and classification of assets or the amounts and classifications of liabilities that may result should we be unable to continue as a going concern.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>

	- 32 -

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	On March 19, 2016, we entered into a securities purchase agreement with an unaffiliated third party, whereby we sold a convertible promissory note in an amount of $200,000.&#160; The purchaser also received a three-year warrant to purchase 100,000 shares of our common stock at an exercise price of $0.40 per share.&#160; The convertible promissory note is convertible after 180 days into shares of our common stock at a twenty-five percent (25%) discount to the volume weighted average price for the five (5) trading days prior to the date of conversion.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	The securities were sold in reliance upon exemptions from registration pursuant to Section 4(a)(2) and Section 4(6) under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Cash Requirements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We believe that cash flow from operations will not meet our present and near-term cash needs and thus we will require additional cash resources, including the sale of equity or debt securities, to meet our planned capital expenditures and working capital requirements for the next 12 months.&#160; We estimate that our capital needs over the next twelve month period to be $500,000 to $750,000.&#160; We will require additional cash resources to continue expanding the distribution of our brands and to fund our operations.&#160; If our own financial resources and future current cash-flows from operations are insufficient to satisfy our capital requirements, we may seek to sell additional equity or debt securities or obtain additional credit facilities.&#160; The sale of additional equity securities will result in dilution to our stockholders.&#160; The incurrence of indebtedness will result in increased debt service obligations and could require us to agree to operating and financial covenants that could restrict our operations or modify our plans to grow the business.&#160; Financing may not be available in amounts or on terms acceptable to us, if at all.&#160; Any failure by us to raise additional funds on terms favorable to us, or at all, will limit our ability to expand our business operations and could harm our overall business prospects.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Future Financing
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	The Company will require additional funds to implement the Company's growth strategy for its business.&#160; In addition, while the Company received funding from the sale of its brewery operations, these funds were largely used for corporate operational and working capital purposes.&#160; Therefore, the Company will need to raise additional capital to sufficiently support its supply chain and support the distribution of its products in the marketplace.&#160; These funds may be raised through equity financing, debt financing, or other sources, which may result in further dilution in the equity ownership of the Company's shares.&#160; There can be no assurance that additional financing will be available to the company when needed or, if available, that it can be obtained on commercially reasonable terms.&#160; If the Company is not able to obtain the additional financing on a timely basis should it be required, or generate significant material revenues from operations, the Company will not be able to meet its other obligations as they become due and will be forced to scale down or perhaps even cease the Company's operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We have no off-balance sheet arrangements that have or are reasonably likely to have a current or future effect on our financial condition, changes in financial condition, revenues or expenses, results of operations, liquidity, capital expenditures or capital resources that is material to stockholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our significant accounting policies are more fully described in the notes to our consolidated financial statements included herein for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2015.&#160; We believe that the accounting policies below are critical for one to fully understand and evaluate our financial condition and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	- 33 -
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Concentrations of Credit Risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Financial instruments that potentially subject the Company to concentrations of credit risk consist principally of cash and accounts receivables.&#160; We place our cash with high credit quality financial institutions.&#160; At times such amounts may exceed federally insured limits.&#160; Receivables arising from sales of our products are not collateralized.&#160; As of December 31, 2015 (Successor), three customers represented approximately 92.8% (59.0%, 22.9% and 10.9%) of accounts receivable.&#160; As of December 31, 2014 (Predecessor), four customers represented approximately 75.1% (25.4%, 24.0%, 13.5% and 12.1%) of accounts receivable.&#160; For the nine months ended December 31, 2015 (Successor), three customers represented approximately 75.6% (32.7%, 24.2% and 18.6%) of total revenue.&#160; For the three months ended March 31, 2015 (Predecessor), three customers represented approximately 85.6% (30.2%, 29.4% and 26.0%) of total revenue.&#160; For the year ended December 31, 2014 (Predecessor), four customers represented approximately 84.5% (28.1%, 18.9%, 18.9% and 18.6%) of revenue.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Accounts Receivable Factoring Arrangement with Recourse
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	In April 2015, we entered into a factoring agreement to sell, with recourse, certain receivables to an unrelated third-party financial institution.&#160; Under the terms of the factoring agreement, we receive an advance of 80% of qualified receivables and maximum amount of outstanding advances at any one time will not exceed $500,000.&#160; For the nine months ended December 31, 2015 (Successor), we received net advances from the factoring of accounts receivable of $110,663 and recognized factoring interest and fees of $34,069.&#160; We pay factoring fees associated with the sale of receivables at the rate of 0.67% of the gross face value of the receivable for every ten-day period or fraction thereof from the date of the advance until the receivable is paid in full.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Goodwill and Intangible Assets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Goodwill represents the excess of the purchase price of acquired businesses over the estimated fair value of the identifiable net assets acquired.&#160; Goodwill is not amortized but is tested for impairment at least annually at the reporting unit level or more frequently if events or changes in circumstances indicate that the asset might be impaired.&#160; The goodwill impairment test is applied by performing a qualitative assessment before calculating the fair value of the reporting unit.&#160; If, on the basis of qualitative factors, it is considered not more likely than not that the fair value of the reporting unit is less than the carrying amount, further testing of goodwill for impairment would not be required.&#160; Otherwise, goodwill impairment is tested using a two-step approach.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Intangible assets are recorded at acquisition cost less accumulated amortization and impairment. Definite lived intangible assets are amortized over their estimated useful life using the straight-line method, which is determined by identifying the period over which the cash flows from the asset are expected to be generated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Share-Based Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We account for stock-based compensation to employees in accordance with FASB ASC 718,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	Compensation&#8212;Stock Compensation.
</FONT>
	&#160; Stock-based compensation to employees is measured at the grant date, based on the fair value of the award, and is recognized as expense over the requisite employee service period.&#160; We account for stock-based compensation to other than employees in accordance with FASB ASC 505-50.&#160; Equity instruments issued to other than employees are valued at the earlier of a commitment date or upon completion of the services, based on the fair value of the equity instruments and is recognized as expense over the service period.&#160; We estimate the fair value of stock-based payments using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model for common stock options and warrants and the latest fair market price of the Company's common stock for common share issuances.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	- 34 -
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 8PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Inventories and Provision for Excess or Expired Inventory
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Inventories consist of tea ingredients, packaging and finished goods and are stated at the lower of cost (first-in, first-out basis) or market value.&#160; Provisions for excess inventory are included in cost of goods sold and have historically been immaterial but adequate to provide for losses on its raw materials.&#160; There was no reserve for obsolescence as of December 31, 2015 (Successor) and December 31, 2014 (Predecessor).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Long-lived Assets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our long-lived assets consisted of property and equipment and customer relationships and are reviewed for impairment in accordance with the guidance of the FASB Topic ASC 360,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Property, Plant, and Equipment
</FONT>
	.&#160; We test for impairment losses on long-lived assets used in operations whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of the asset may not be recoverable.&#160; Through December 31, 2015, we had not experienced impairment losses on its long-lived assets as management determined that there were no indicators that a carrying amount of the asset may not be recoverable.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Revenue Recognition
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our products are distributed in major health and grocery chains throughout North America.&#160; Revenue is recognized upon delivery of goods to the customer.&#160; An allowance for estimated returns is provided at the time of the sale.&#160; In accordance with the guidance in FASB Topic ASC 605, Revenue Recognition, we recognize revenue when (a) persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, (b) delivery has occurred or services have been rendered, (c) the fee is fixed or determinable, and (d) collectability is reasonable assured.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We do not believe that any recently issued, but not yet effective accounting pronouncements, if adopted, would have a material effect on our financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;

<EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES"></A>

</DIV>
<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	ITEM 9A. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	The Company maintains disclosure controls and procedures that are designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed in our reports filed under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the SEC's rules and forms, and that such information is accumulated and communicated to our management, including our interim president and chief executive officer (who is the Company's principal executive officer) and our chief financial officer, treasurer, and secretary (who is the Company's principal financial officer and principal accounting officer) to allow for timely decisions regarding required disclosure.&#160; In designing and evaluating our disclosure controls and procedures, management recognizes that any controls and procedures, no matter how well designed and operated, can provide only reasonable assurance of achieving the desired control objectives, and management is required to apply its judgment in evaluating the cost-benefit relationship of possible controls and procedures.&#160; The ineffectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures was due to material weaknesses identified in our internal control over financial reporting, described below.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Management's Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over the Company's financial reporting.&#160; In order to evaluate the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, as required by Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002.&#160; Our management, with the participation of our principal executive officer and principal financial officer has conducted an assessment, including testing, using the criteria in Internal Control - Integrated Framework, issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission ("COSO") (2013).&#160; Our system of internal control over financial reporting is designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.&#160; Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements.&#160; This assessment included review of the documentation of controls, evaluation of the design effectiveness of controls, testing of the operating effectiveness of controls and a conclusion on this evaluation.&#160; Based on this evaluation, management concluded that our internal control over financial reporting was not effective as of December 31, 2015.&#160; The ineffectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting was due to the following material weaknesses which are indicative of many small companies with small staff:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="889EF23E12AA435BAE26F28A8FF8511F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	inadequate segregation of duties consistent with control objectives; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="82B4A24184A647D69F78C01D566FF7CA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	ineffective controls over period end financial disclosure and reporting processes including a lack of multiple levels of supervision and review.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	- 36 -
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our management feels the weaknesses identified above have not had any material affect on our financial results.&#160; However, we are currently reviewing our disclosure controls and procedures related to these material weaknesses and expect to implement changes in the next fiscal year, including identifying specific areas within our governance, accounting and financial reporting processes to add adequate resources to potentially mitigate these material weaknesses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our management will continue to monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of our internal controls and procedures and our internal controls over financial reporting on an ongoing basis and is committed to taking further action and implementing additional enhancements or improvements, as necessary and as funds allow.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal controls over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements.&#160; Projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.&#160; All internal control systems, no matter how well designed, have inherent limitations.&#160; Therefore, even those systems determined to be effective can provide only reasonable assurance with respect to financial statement preparation and presentation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Changes in Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	There were no changes in our internal control over financial reporting during the year ended December 31, 2015 that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect our internal control over financial reporting.&#160; We believe that a control system, no matter how well designed and operated, cannot provide absolute assurance that the objectives of the control system are met, and no evaluation of controls can provide absolute assurance that all control issues and instances of fraud, if any, within any company have been detected.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Management's Remediation Plan
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	We
</FONT>
	plan to take steps to enhance and improve the design of our internal control over financial reporting.&#160; During the period covered by this annual report on Form 10-K, we have not been able to remediate the material weaknesses identified above.&#160; To remediate such weaknesses, we plan to implement the following changes in the next fiscal year as resources allow:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="475B018DD459415EB8B42466A29741D9" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; WIDTH: 35.45PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<DIV>
	appoint additional qualified personnel to address inadequate segregation of duties and ineffective risk management and implement modifications to our financial controls to address such inadequacies; and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE ID="34C2F872EFC54B8EA09C5FBE205A3CDC" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; WIDTH: 35.45PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<DIV>
	adopt sufficient written policies and procedures for accounting and financial reporting.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	The remediation efforts set out in (i) is largely dependent upon our company securing additional financing to cover the costs of hiring the requisite personnel and implementing the changes required.&#160; If we are unsuccessful in securing such funds, remediation efforts may be adversely affected in a material manner.&#160; Because of the inherent limitations in all control systems, no evaluation of controls can provide absolute assurance that all control issues, if any, within our company have been detected.&#160; These inherent limitations include the realities that judgments in decision-making can be faulty and that breakdowns can occur because of simple error or mistake.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Management believes that despite our material weaknesses set forth above, our financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2015 are fairly stated, in all material respects, in accordance with U.S. GAAP.
</DIV>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

	Director
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID; WIDTH: 8.18%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	52
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID; WIDTH: 24.94%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	August 14, 2014
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Business Experience
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	The following is a brief account of the education and business experience of our directors and executive officers during the past five years, indicating their principal occupation during the period, and the name and principal business of the organization by which they were employed
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT: 10PT/11.4PT 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF">
<U>
	Brent David Willis &#8211; Interim Chief Executive Officer, Interim Chief Financial Officer and Director
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Brent Willis was named Interim Chief Executive Officer, Interim Chief Financial Officer and a director of the Company on March 24, 2016.&#160; Since 2008, Mr. Willis has been the minority or majority owner and served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of a number of private-equity backed companies including Unified Learning, LLC, Vivitris Life Sciences, Inc., XFit Brands, Inc. (OTCQB:XFTB), Throwdown Industries Inc., Electronic Cigarettes International Group, Ltd. (OTCQB:ECIG), Liberty Ammunition, Inc., and Vascular Technologies Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	- 38 -
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Mr. Willis served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Cott Corporation from May 2006 to April 2008.&#160; From July 2002 until May 2006, Mr. Willis work for Anheuser-Busch InBev (NYSE:BUD) in numerous senior leadership capacities including Zone President, Chief Commercial Officer, Chief Marketing and Sales Officer, Board of Management Member, Board Director for numerous subsidiaries companies and joint ventures, and Board Director for AmBev (NYSE:ABEV).&#160; While at AB InBev, he developed and implemented the strategy that transformed AB InBev into the world's largest beer company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	From 1996 to 2001, Mr. Willis served as a President in Latin America for the Coca-Cola Company (NYSE:KO).&#160; From 1987 until 1996, Mr. Willis worked for Kraft Heinz (NASDAQ:KHC) in the United States, Asia Pacific, and Latin America in various Marketing and General Management capacities.&#160; At Kraft, he developed led numerous brands, developed the Category Management System for the Company, and launched the Kraft Brand in China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Mr. Willis began his career in the US Army as a 2
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	nd
</SUP>
	Lieutenant and served in various leadership capacities in Combat Arms in the 1
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	st
</SUP>
	Cavalry Division and other military units.&#160; He was awarded numerous decorations and received an honorable discharge in 1987 with the rank of Captain.&#160; Mr. Willis earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering from the U.S. Military Academy at West Point in 1982 and an MBA from the University of Chicago in 1991.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<U>
	Neil Fallon &#8211;Executive Chairman and Director
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Neil Fallon was promoted to Executive Chairman, a newly created role, on March 24, 2016.&#160; Prior to this, Mr. Fallon has been Chief Executive Officer and a Director of the Company since inception.&#160; He has served as a director of the Company due to the fact that he is the founder and possesses valuable business experience related to acting in a management role. In the new role as Executive Chairman, Mr. Fallon will be providing strategic leadership for the Company. Mr. Fallon previously owned his own residential real estate developing company, where he has developed and built over 100 homes sites through California and Washington States.&#160; He specialized in the development of infill properties averaging in the range of 30-50 home sites.&#160; His companies averaged approximately $8,000,000 in annual revenues and employed hundreds of sub contractors.&#160; Before moving to Washington, Mr. Fallon was a Business Development Manager at Netbrowser, a technology company focused on web-based facilities management.&#160; He was responsible for traveling extensively throughout the United States and Europe and securing strategic alliances, establishing channel sales and performing installations and tune-ups of the Company's systems.&#160; Mr. Fallon has a BA in Business Administration with Concentrations in Finance and Marketing from Western Washington University.&#160; Mr. Fallon has no other work experience during the previous five years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<U>
	Julie Anderson &#8211; Vice-President and Director
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Julie Anderson has been Vice President and a Director of the Company since December 31, 2012, and was appointed as an officer and director of the Company due to her previous relationship with the Company and knowledge of the Company's business operations and goals.&#160; From January 2011 until December 31, 2012, Ms. Anderson handled the marketing, promotion, and social media of American Brewing Company as well as oversight of the operations of its tasting room.&#160; Also from September 2010 to May of 2011, she was a substitute para-educator for the University Place School District.&#160; In July of 2010, Ms. Anderson moved to Tacoma, WA from San Jose, CA. From December 1999 to June of 2010, Ms. Anderson was the office manager of Almaden Valley Counseling Service, a non-profit organization in San Jose, CA.&#160; Ms. Anderson has no other work experience during the previous five years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

	- 39 -

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<U>
	Simon Majumdar - Director
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Simon Majumdar has been a director of the Company since August 14, 2014.&#160; Mr. Majumdar is a world renowned broadcaster and author who has dedicated the second half of his life to fulfill his ambition to "Go Everywhere.&#160; Eat Everything".&#160; It is a journey that has taken him to all fifty states and to dozens of countries around the world.&#160; He has written two books; "Eat My Globe" and "Eating for Britain".&#160; His latest book, "Fed, White and Blue", which catalogs his journey to American citizenship, was published by Avery Press (an imprint of Penguin Books) in 2015. Simon is also a well-recognized personality on the Food Network, regularly appearing on shows such as Iron Chef America, The Next Iron Chef, The Best Thing I Ever Ate, Cutthroat Kitchen, Extreme Chef and Beat Bobby Flay.&#160; He has also recently appeared as an expert commentator on National Geographic's major new series "EAT: The Story of Food".
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Family Relationships
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	There are no family relationships among our directors and executive officers.&#160; No director or executive officer has been a director or executive officer of any business which has filed a bankruptcy petition or had a bankruptcy petition filed against it.&#160; No director or executive officer has been convicted of a criminal offense within the past five years or is the subject of a pending criminal proceeding.&#160; No director or executive officer has been the subject of any order, judgment or decree of any court permanently or temporarily enjoining, barring, suspending or otherwise limiting his involvement in any type of business, securities or banking activities.&#160; No director or officer has been found by a court to have violated a federal or state securities or commodities law.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Significant Employees
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<U>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF">
	Chuck Santry &#8211;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF">
	b&#250;cha
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF">
	Chief Operating Officer
</FONT>
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Chuck Santry has been the b&#250;cha
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Chief Operating Officer of the b&#250;cha
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Live Kombucha Company since the April 1, 2015 acquisition of the business.&#160; Mr. Santry has over 20 years of sales and management experience in the consumer packaged goods and food industry.&#160; Most recently Mr. Santry was the National Sales Manager for Sabra Dipping Company, a joint venture of PepsiCo, Inc. (NYSE:PEP) and the Strauss Group from 2010 until 2015.&#160; Prior to that he was the Director of Sales for California Creative Foods, Inc. from 1994 to 2010.&#160; In that position he was responsible for creating the leading salsa in the perishable category.&#160; Mr. Santry has served on the boards of various non-profit Companies throughout his career.&#160; Mr. Santry holds a Bachelor of Sciences degree from University of Southern California, Marshall School of Business.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.4PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<U>
	Frank Commanday &#8211;
</U>
<U>
	b&#250;cha
</U>
<U>
	Technical Director and Head Brew Master
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Frank Commanday has been the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-VARIANT: NORMAL; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	b&#250;cha
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
</FONT>
	Technical Director and Head Brew Master of the Company since the April 1, 2015 acquisition of the b&#250;cha live Kombucha brand, where he worked since September 2009.&#160; Mr. Commanday has over 25 years of practical brewing experience playing a critical role in the success and development of two of Oregon's first microbreweries.&#160; From May 2007 to October 2008, Mr. Commanday was the Technical Director of start-up company, Golden Star Tea Company.&#160; From June 2004 to April 2007, he was the Customer Service Manager of Brewers Supply Group.&#160; From June 1997 to September 2002, he was Master Brewer at E&amp;O Trading Company, a downtown San Francisco brewing restaurant.&#160; From January 1987 to January 1996, he was Q/A Manager of Widmer Brothers Brewing Co.&#160; Prior to this, he worked in various technical and management positions with Sierra Nevada Brewing Co (1982), and Portland Brewing Co. (1985-1986).&#160; Mr. Commanday received his Bachelor of Arts in Biology from University of California, Santa Cruz in 1979 and a Masters of Arts in Microbiology from University of California, Davis in 1984.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Committees of Board of Directors
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	There are currently no committees of the Board of Directors.&#160; Our board of directors is of the view that it is appropriate for us not to have a standing nominating, audit or compensation committee because the current size of our board of directors does not facilitate the establishment of a separate committee.&#160; Our board of directors has performed, and will perform adequately, the functions of any specific committee.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Term of Office
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our directors cease to hold office immediately before their election at an annual general meeting or their appointment by the unanimous resolution of our shareholders, but are eligible for reelection or reappointment.&#160; Notwithstanding the foregoing, our directors hold office until their successors are elected or appointed, or until their deaths, resignations or removals.&#160; Our officers hold office at the discretion of our board of directors, or until their deaths, resignations or removals.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Potential Conflicts of Interest
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We are not aware of any conflicts of interest with our directors and officers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Director Independence
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our board of directors consists of Brent Willis, Neil Fallon, Julie Anderson and Simon Majumdar.&#160; Our securities are quoted on the OTCQB which does not have any director independence requirements.&#160; Under NASDAQ Marketplace Rule 5605(a)(2), a director is not considered to be independent if he or she is also an executive officer or employee of the company.&#160; Using this definition of independence, we have determined that only one member, Simon Majumdar, is an independent director.&#160; Brent Willis, Neil Fallon and Julie Anderson are not independent as they are officers and employees of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Compliance
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act, as amended, requires our executive officers and directors, and persons who own more than 10% of our common stock, to file reports regarding ownership of, and transactions in, our securities with the Securities and Exchange Commission and to provide us with copies of those filings.&#160; Based solely on our review of the copies of such forms received by us, or written representations from certain reporting persons, during the year ended December 31, 2015, the filing requirements applicable to its officers, directors and greater than 10% beneficial owners were complied.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	ITEM 11. EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Summary Compensation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	No executive officer of the Company received compensation in excess of $100,000 for the nine months ended December 31, 2015 (Successor), the three months ended March 31, 2015 (Predecessor), and the year ended December 31, 2014 (Predecessor).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Compensation Discussion and Analysis
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Brent David Willis, our Interim Chief Executive Officer, Interim Chief Financial Officer and Director joined the Company in March 2016.&#160; As of April 5, 2016, the effective date of this filing, Mr. Willis' compensation has not been finalized or approved the by the board of directors.&#160; Management expect to finalize and obtain board approval of Mr. Willis' compensation package and equity participation within 30 days at which time, the Company will advise its shareholders by filing a Current Report on Form 8-K, if required.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Neil Fallon, our Executive Chairman and Director, receives an annual salary of $100,000 per year plus $1000 per month medical reimbursement. Mr. Fallon was paid $84,000 for the nine months ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	b&#250;cha
</FONT>
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	Chief Operating Officer, receives an annual salary of $100,000 per year plus $1000 per month medical reimbursement.&#160; Mr. Santry was paid $84,000 for the nine months ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>

<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	We have no contract, agreement, plan or arrangement, whether written or unwritten, that provides for payments to our directors or executive officers at, following, or in connection with the resignation, retirement or other termination of our directors or executive officers, or a change in control of our company or a change in our directors' or executive officers' responsibilities following a change in control.

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	All directors receive reimbursement for reasonable out of pocket expenses in attending board of directors' meetings and for promoting our business.&#160; From time to time we may engage certain members of the board of directors to perform services on our behalf.&#160; In such cases, we intend to compensate the members for their services at rates no more favorable than could be obtained from unaffiliated parties.
</DIV>

<EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITY_OWNERS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	ITEM 12. SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT AND RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	The following tables set forth, as of April 5, 2016, certain information with respect to the beneficial ownership of our common stock by each stockholder known by us to be the beneficial owner of more than 5% of our common stock and by each of our current directors and executive officers.&#160; Each person has sole voting and investment power with respect to the shares of common stock, except as otherwise indicated. Beneficial ownership consists of a direct interest in the shares of common stock, except as otherwise indicated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	In the following tables, we have determined the number and percentage of shares beneficially owned in accordance with Rule 13d3 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 based on information provided to us by our controlling stockholder, executive officers and directors, and this information does not necessarily indicate beneficial ownership for any other purpose. In determining the number of shares of our common stock beneficially owned by a person and the percentage ownership of that person, we include any shares as to which the person has sole or shared voting power or investment power, as well as any shares subject to warrants or options held by that person that are currently exercisable or exercisable within 60 days.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Director Independence
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our board of directors consists of Neil Fallon, Julie Anderson and Simon Majumdar.&#160; Our securities are quoted on the OTCQB which does not have any director independence requirements.&#160; Under NASDAQ Marketplace Rule 5605(a)(2), a director is not considered to be independent if he or she is also an executive officer or employee of the company.&#160; Using this definition of independence, we have determined that only one member, Simon Majumdar, is an independent director.&#160; Neil Fallon and Julie Anderson are not independent as they are both officers and employees of the Company.
</DIV>

<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

	For the year ended December 31, 2015, the audit related fees shown in the table above are related to the historical audit of B&amp;R Liquid Adventure, LLC. as of December 31, 2014 and 2013 and for the years ended December 31, 2014 and 2013, as well as the review of the three-month periods ended March 31, 2015 and 2014 (unaudited).&#160; On April 1, 2015, we acquired the b&#250;cha&#174; Live Kombucha brand and the assets related to the production and sale of it.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

</DIV>

	Pre-Approval Policies and Procedures
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Our board of directors preapproves all services provided by our independent registered public accounting firm.&#160; All of the above services and fees were reviewed and approved by the board of directors before the respective services were rendered.&#160; Our board of directors has considered the nature and amount of fees billed by HMAC and MaloneBailey and believes that the provision of services for activities unrelated to the audit is compatible with maintaining their respective independence.
</DIV>
